instructions:
Parboil carrots 10 minutes, drain and set aside. In large skillet brown pork on both sides in hot oil.
Remove from skillet and set aside. Drain excess fat from skillet. Drain pineapple, reserving juice. Add
additional pineapple or orange juice to make 1 cup. Combine juice mixture with soy sauce, vinegar, sugar
and ginger. Add liquid to skillet and deglaze. Return pork to skillet along with carrots, onion and pepper
strips. Cover and simmer 20 to 25 minutes or until meat and carrots are tender.
Remove pork and vegetables from skillet to a warmed casserole. Dissolve cornstarch in 2 tbsp of water
and add to liquid in skillet. Cook and stir sauce until slightly thickened and bubbly. Add pineapple chunks
and heat for 3 more minutes. Pour over meat and vegetables in casserole. Serve with rice. 
*(Rev. 4/21/00)*
ingredients: 4 pork blade (or butt) steaks, 1/2 inch thick
1 can (8 oz) pineapple chunks, drained saving juice
1 cup total of above saved pineapple juice and added additional pineapple or orange juice
1 small green pepper, seeded and cut in 1/2 inch
name: Oriental Style Pork Steaks
creator: Carol Decker
